title: Programming Base R
text:
We will define our pre and post treatment blood pressure vectors, ensuring we label the patients accordingly.

pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
names(pre_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
names(post_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")




We will save these differences (pre-post) as a vector. We are curious what the mean difference is.

diff_bp <- pre_bp - post_bp
mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65





Which subjects saw a decrease in blood pressure?

names(which(diff_bp>0))

 [1] "Subject_2"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8" 
 [6] "Subject_9"  "Subject_10" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[11] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"





What is the mean decrease among these subjects?

mean(diff_bp[diff_bp>0])

[1] 10.6

title: Programming Base R
text:
We will define our pre and post treatment blood pressure vectors, ensuring we label the patients accordingly.

pre_bp <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
names(pre_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")

post_bp <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
names(post_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")

title: Programming Base R
text:
We will save these differences (pre-post) as a vector. We are curious what the mean difference is.

diff_bp <- pre_bp - post_bp
mean(diff_bp)

[1] 5.65

title: Programming Base R
text:
Which subjects saw a decrease in blood pressure?

names(which(diff_bp>0))

 [1] "Subject_2"  "Subject_4"  "Subject_6"  "Subject_7"  "Subject_8" 
 [6] "Subject_9"  "Subject_10" "Subject_13" "Subject_14" "Subject_15"
[11] "Subject_16" "Subject_17" "Subject_18" "Subject_19" "Subject_20"

title: Programming Base R
text:
What is the mean decrease among these subjects?

mean(diff_bp[diff_bp>0])

[1] 10.6

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q1
Lets create an data frame using the above vectors.

bp_df <- data.frame(patient=names(pre_bp),pre_bp, post_bp, diff_bp, row.names = NULL)

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q2
Which of the patients in our data frame saw an increase in blood pressure?

bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp<0,]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q3 and Q4
Lets add a column to check whose post blood pressure is less than 120, and display our data frame.

bp_df$post_less120 <- bp_df$post_bp<120
knitr::kable(bp_df)

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q1
We are doing the exact same thing we did with the treatment group except with the placebo group to create a data frame.

pre_bp2 <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
names(pre_bp2) <- paste("Subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
post_bp2 <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
names(post_bp) <- paste("Subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
diff_bp2 <- pre_bp2-post_bp2
bp_df2 <- data.frame(patient=names(pre_bp2),pre_bp2, post_bp2, diff_bp2, row.names = NULL)
bp_df2$post_less120 <- bp_df2$post_bp<120
knitr::kable(bp_df2)




patient
pre_bp2
post_bp2
diff_bp2
post_less120

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q2
Now we will stack our two data frames, one for treatment one for placebo in a list.

bp_list <- list(treatment=bp_df, placebo=bp_df2)

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q3

title: Programming Base R
text:
Q4
Finally we need to access the pre blood pressure placebo column of data in our above list.

bp_list$placebo$pre_bp2

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130
